passages.text: Post 2Q25 Results Investor Meetings takeaways

We hosted investor meetings in Hong Kong post Xiaomi's 2Q25 results. Investors' questions focused on EV capacity and profitability, IoT growth slowdown, and smartphone GM. Key takeaways: (1) Management reiterated its 350K EV shipment target by enhancing production efficiency. July EV shipments exceeded 30k, and August, it expects, will be higher than July. (2) Solid EV GM was driven by supply chain and higher ASP/product mix in 2Q. (3) 3Q25 IoT sales could decline QoQ on seasonality and subsidy patterns. (4) SEA is a high- potential market for the IoT business. (5) AI Glasses sales are better than expected, with upside to shipments. (6) 3Q25 smartphone GM is under pressure but 4Q will rebound, per mgmt. (6) Majority of overseas new retail stores setup in SE A currently. Maintain Buy. Near- term catalysts: Mi 16 launch, ramping EV deliveries/orders, new EV edition updates.

EV business: Management is confident about its 350k units EV shipments target this year, by enhancing production efficiency. July EV shipments exceeded 30k, and August will be higher than July, per mgmt. The order conversion from SU7 to YU7 is limited, less than 15%. Despite long lead time of YU7, cancellations are limited. The company is also making attempts to filter out scalpers. The strong GM of 26.4% for EV/Al+ segment was driven by supply- chain management, product mix improvement, higher ASP, high option rate etc. Currently, SU7 and YU7 users are mostly single drivers with an average age in the 30- ish; future models aim to expand the customer segment. Europe is the first stage for the overseas market in 2027; it is a big market, left- hand drive and focus is on the high- end segment.

IoT business: Management reiterated its FY guidance of 25- 30% YoY growth and 2- 2.5 ppts GM improvement. 3Q25 sales would come down QoQ on seasonality, subsidy spending pattern. For home appliances, the company plans to continue to strengthen its in- house core technology development. AI Glasses sales are better than expected, with potential upside to shipments. Overseas IoT business accounted for 30- 40% of the mix. The company reiterated the target of tripling the AIoT biz in the overseas market in the next 3 years. Management sees SEA as a high- potential market, given similar business models, logistics and consumer behavior.

Smartphone business: The overall smartphone market is slower than expected early this year. According to third- party data, global smartphones will decline 0.6% YoY in 2025 while China grows 1.1% YoY. The full- year c.175mn target is still intact. The DDR price hike was out of line from expectations early this year; it sees 3Q25 GM under pressure, but 4Q is likely to rebound on new product launches. Premiumization

strategy remains intact; the company targets \(1\%\) market- share gain in China every year; there is potential in expanding share in offline channels ( \(12\%\) in offline channels currently vs. its \(15 - 16\%\) market share in China). The long- term 200mn shipment target remains intact.

Overseas new retail model: There were 200 Mi Home Stores overseas in 1H25, with the number set to increase to 400- 500 stores in 2H25E and likely c.2000 in 2026E. Majority of Mi Home Stores will work with local partners, very few will be self- owned.

Al investment: Xiaomi is committed to Rmb200bn R&D spending in 5 years. Al is one- fourth of R&D spending in 2025. The company builds the Al architecture into three layers- core layer (LLM), PaaS and applications (like smartphone, vehicle, internal operation etc.). The company does not build open source LLM like DeepSeek or OpenAI, but edge Al LLM focus.
Spread 89pp Current Price and expected returns (upside/downside) as of 29 Aug 2025
Re- rate to 35x P/E for smartphone, loT and Internet; 2x P/S for EV
SOTP based on 25.4x P/E for smartphone and loT and Internet; 1.5x P/S for EV
De- rate to 15x P/E for smartphone, loT and Internet; 1x P/S for EV

We value Xiaomi shares at HK\$66.0 using a sum- of- the- parts (SOTP) valuation on 2026E basis given solid long- term visibility. Our SOTP valuation is set at 25.4x for the core smartphone, IoT, and internet services business earnings (in- line with mid- to- upcycle of 3- year average P/E), and 1.5x smart EV sales (higher than industry peers average given better ASP). These multiples are also justified by the company's growth outlook, in our view.

Downside risks that could prevent the shares from reaching our target price include: 1) stiffer- than- expected competition in the smartphone market; 2) a smaller- than- expected smartphone share gain from Huawei; 3) rising expense pressures on new store expansions; and 4) quick rising interest rates leading to de- rating.

**Guide to Citi Research Fundamental Research Investment Ratings:**
Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks.
**Risk** rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

**Investment Ratings:** Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "-" respectively in the rating history price

chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
